intro: Eupatorium tequendamense f. typicum, commonly known as the typical form of the species, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
